name: ($)General Store
description: Greetings, Bandit. I am the proprieter of the Corporate Shop. You may call me Penny. As you help us explore and research the profitability of the new world you have discovered, more items will become available for purchase from my shop. This is the General Shop, where you'll find various food items, seeds, furniture, and more. It is also where you can trade in Coins for Vouchers. Come inside!

quests.name: Rules of the Shop
quests.description: Nice to meet you, Bandit. My shop has a few rules you should be aware of :                                   1) Only Shop Vouchers and Silver       Coins are accepted currency.    2) Each purchase gets you a             Shop Loyalty point.                  3) Higher Shop Loyalty Tiers get        you a better Voucher                  Exchange Rate.                    What are Vouchers you ask? Patrons of this shop are able to exchange a stack of Silver Coins for a paper voucher. This is much easier and lighter to carry, and if you purchase enough from this Shop, you can get the Vouchers for cheaper! It's my version of a Rewards Program.
prerequisites: {Initial Research}[Its The Name of the Game]

tasks.longDescription: As a new patron of this Shop, you get the basic exchange rate : 10 Silver Coins for 1 Voucher.           You will get a bigger discount when you hit Iron Tier.

quests.name: Tin Exchange Rate
quests.description: Now that you've made a good number of purchases and Voucher exchanges, you've reached the Tin tier of my Rewards Program. Vouchers will now only cost you 9 Silver Coins instead of 10!

tasks.longDescription: The next exchange rate unlocks at Iron.

quests.name: Iron Exchange Rate
quests.description: You've reached the Iron tier of my rewards program! Each voucher now only costs you 8 Silver Coins! To boot, I think the CEO would like to talk to you...he left a message in the Armament section of the Shop.

tasks.longDescription: The next exchange rate unlocks at Steel.

quests.name: Steel Exchange Rate
quests.description: You are quite the customer! You've reached the Steel tier, and a 7 to 1 exchange ratio!

tasks.longDescription: The next exchange rate unlocks at Emerald.

quests.name: Emerald Exchange Rate
quests.description: What a consumer! You've bought ton from my Shop, Bandit, and you've hit Emerald tier! Six to one exchange, and you are well on your way to the top customer list!

tasks.longDescription: The next exchange rate unlocks at Diamond.

quests.name: Diamond Exchange Rate
quests.description: You are totally my best customer, Bandit. You've reached the Diamond Tier and the best exchange rate!

tasks.longDescription: This is the highest exchange rate!

quests.name: Dimensional Testing - Uncommon
quests.description: These Dimlets are somewhat rarer and more expensive.

tasks.longDescription: This shipment contains a single Dimlet of Rarity 3 or 4.

quests.name: Dimensional Testing - Common
quests.description: One of the newest departments (aside from the influx of Magical ones you seem to have caused the formation of...) has some things they'd like to sell you. They said they don't have much information on these, but they have a wide variety of them, and that they contain computational instructions to build entire worlds with. They say they haven't gotten far in their research yet, but wanted to help drum up Research funds by offering what they call Dimlets up for sale and research.

tasks.longDescription: This shipment contains a single Rarity level 0, 1, or 2 Dimlet for RFTool's Dimension Builder.

quests.name: Epic Blind Bag
quests.description: Every Blind Bag after Basic is guaranteed to only have one of our other Blind Bags in it. The Epic Blind Bag contains either a Good or Amazing Blind Bag, but will cost you 200 Shop Vouchers.

quests.name: Legendary Blind Bag Blind Bag
quests.description: Every Blind Bag after Basic is guaranteed to only have one of our other Blind Bags in it. The Legendary Blind Bag will ONLY contain Amazing blind bags, but will set you back 500 Shop Vouchers.

quests.name: Basic Blind Bag
quests.description: Our most popular, best selling item ever. The Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags contains one of two things : a random item (which, as it says on the bag, is USUALLY junk!) but it also has a chance of containing ANY Blind Bag that The Ferret Business makes! This includes the Amazing blind bags, which usually costs 500 Shop Vouchers, but instead you can take a little gamble with a Basic Bag for only 25 Shop Vouchers!

tasks.longDescription: The Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags has a chance of either a single junk item, a pretty decent item, TWO Basic Blind Bags, some coins, or ANY of the other Blind Bags we have!

quests.name: Good Blind Bag
quests.description: Every Blind Bag after Basic is guaranteed to only have one of our other Blind Bags in it. The Good Blind Bag contains either a Cheap or a Decent Blind Bag, but will cost you 50 Shop Vouchers.

quests.name: Dimensional Testing - Rare
quests.description: According to the lab, these are the most powerful Dimlets they have found thus far. Using them in your research will require a lot of planning and resources, they warn.

tasks.longDescription: This shipment contains a single Dimlet of Rarity 5 or 6.

quests.name: Greater Blind Bag
quests.description: Every Blind Bag after Basic is guaranteed to only have one of our other Blind Bags in it. The Greater Blind Bag contains either a Decent or a Good Blind Bag, but will cost you 100 Shop Vouchers.

quests.name: Etheral Guardian
quests.description: The Thaumaturgic Branch would like to pass along a warning : the data they are looking at from your QUEST Tablet says that an ancient magical scourge is present in your world, one that eventually consumes all if left to its own device. They say it is simply called Taint. They know of a way to combat it, but its power is magically taxing and requires rare ingredients to create which...well, rare equals expensive, of course.

tasks.longDescription: A Wizard's Notes : "These Blooms work in about an eight meter radius and slowly. They will transform the land back to its original state, and not only land that is changed by the corrupted Taint."

quests.name: Mysterious Lillies
quests.description: It appears many of our laboratories are quite enamoried by those creatures you call Endermen. The problem is, we don't exactly have specimens of our own to...ah...'multiply'...so we have only the Ender Pearls you send us. We entrusted a few of these to our master Gardener, who has successfully, somehow, crossbred a lilyseed with one, which enables you to GROW Ender Pearls!

tasks.longDescription: Gardener's Notes "Mind yer thumbs, them is unfriendly to you and anything you drop next to em. They also grow a mite slow, they might go faster if ya grow em on something closer to their natural habitat. Don't feed em fertilizer like ground up bones, its like poison to em."

quests.name: Bagging Up Coins
quests.description: As you do more and more research and sell more materials to The Business, I expect you'll have a whole lot of coins. If you want, I can easily bag them up for you. It makes storing them much easier. You can also put them into an EnderIO SAG Mill to automatically bag them for you.

tasks.longDescription: I used to exchange bags for coins, but since I set up the EnderIO Alloy Smelter to automatically exchange things for you, Bags of Coins will only be used as rewards and to save Inventory space.

quests.name: Auto Exchange
quests.description: See those Exchange Tokens I just gave you? Well, since I forsee us exchanging a whole lot of money soon, I had to work out a temporary solution, as constantly sending things your QUEST Tablet could get...tedious.                           To that end, I've convinced Engineer Erin of the EnderI/O lab to add a little extra to his Alloy Smelter and SAG Mill designs. With the Alloy Smelter, you can put in one of these Exchange Tokens and the appropriate amount of Silver Coins, and it will ship them to me, and send back a Shop Voucher. (I'll cover the SAG Mill in the Contracts section.)                                       This is only temporary until we can design a set of machines specifically for this...unique...situation.

tasks.longDescription: Here, I'll give you one Alloy Smelter so you don't have to worry about getting the infrastructure together to make your own. You'll have to figure out how to power it yourself. I highly suggest a Generator of some sort.

quests.name: Thaumic Research
quests.description: Wizard Watson came by a little bit ago, followed by that cute familiar of his. They were carrying a few boxes of goods to sell. Well, boxes in boxes, in Ferret Business tradition of course. Let's see, there's a note here for you...            "Bandit, given your advancement in Thaumic study, Wiggles and I decided to make available some of our research materials for you...for a price of course. One needs to earn their knowledge in some fashion, after all.                     Each crate carries a single item. Most of the time, it will either be magical shards or some fragments of knowledge from our studies. Nine of these fragments together will create a magical research note to further your studies.                       A bit rarer would be magically created "Eggs", each of which contains...well, a cultist, to put it plainly. There are two kinds of basic cultist, but fret not, as they had already sacrificed their minds and souls to whatever dark creature they serve.                       The rarest item, though, is a special tome from these cultists. One you will need at some point."

tasks.longDescription: The Thaumic Research Crate contains either :                             2 [Basic Crystal Shards]               2 [Thaumic Tinkerer Shards]          2 [Forbidden Magic Shards]           1 [Cultist Banner]                        1 [Angry Zombie Egg]                   1 [Crimson Cleric Egg]                  1 [Crimson Knight Egg]                  1 [Cult Rites Book]
